intro: Turnera velutina, commonly known as velvetleaf turnera, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in the summer months. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties. Turnera velutina is typically found in humid, tropical environments and thrives in partial shade.
